head.title: National Briefing | New England: New Hampshire: Report Cites Dropout Rate

identified-content.org: New Hampshire Center for Public Policy

hedline.hl1: National Briefing | New England: New Hampshire: Report Cites Dropout Rate

abstract.p: New Hampshire Center for Public Policy reports that nearly 25 percent of state's high school students drop out before graduation; Gov Jeanne Shaheen orders educators to develop ways to reduce dropout rate (S)

block.p: Nearly 25 percent of the state's high school students drop out before graduation, a new report has found. Conducted by researchers at the New Hampshire Center for Public Policy, the study shows that the state's official dropout rates are misleading, because they reflect yearly figures rather than cumulative data. Starting with the class of 1996 and ending with the class of 2000, researchers tracked how many students dropped out of a class over four years. Gov. Jeanne Shaheen said she was ordering educators to develop ways to reduce the dropout rate.

Nearly 25 percent of the state's high school students drop out before graduation, a new report has found. Conducted by researchers at the New Hampshire Center for Public Policy, the study shows that the state's official dropout rates are misleading, because they reflect yearly figures rather than cumulative data. Starting with the class of 1996 and ending with the class of 2000, researchers tracked how many students dropped out of a class over four years. Gov. Jeanne Shaheen said she was ordering educators to develop ways to reduce the dropout rate.
